references: Based on our research paper analysis (Section 3), we include 13 datasets in our experiments and refer to Table 1 for an overview. For top-n prediction tasks, we convert rating prediction datasets according to practice that is common in our paper analysis (Zhu et al., 2023; Ma et al., 2023; Chen et al., 2023; Xu et al., 2023a). Furthermore, we prune all datasets such that all included users and items have at least five interactions, commonly known as five-core pruning (Zhu et al., 2023; Ma et al., 2023; Chen et al., 2023; Xu et al., 2023a). Furthermore, we prune all datasets such that all included users and items have at least five interactions, commonly known as five-core pruning (Sun et al., 2019; Yue et al., 2021, 2022). (Sun et al., 2019; Yue et al., 2021, 2022). Table 1 shows the dataset statistics of all included datasets for the preprocessed datasets.

Based on our research paper analysis (Section 3), we include 13 datasets in our experiments and refer to Table 1 for an overview. For top-n prediction tasks, we convert rating prediction datasets according to practice that is common in our paper analysis (Zhu et al., 2023; Ma et al., 2023; Chen et al., 2023; Xu et al., 2023a). Furthermore, we prune all datasets such that all included users and items have at least five interactions, commonly known as five-core pruning (Zhu et al., 2023; Ma et al., 2023; Chen et al., 2023; Xu et al., 2023a). Furthermore, we prune all datasets such that all included users and items have at least five interactions, commonly known as five-core pruning (Sun et al., 2019; Yue et al., 2021, 2022). We run algorithms from RecBole on a GPU while we run algorithms from LensKit and RecPack on a CPU. Table 2 shows all algorithm implementations used in our experiments.

Year and Prediction Type 2013 Rating Prediction ItemKNNLK, UserKNNLK, BiasedMFLK, FunkSVDLK Movielens-100K, Movielens-1M, Netflix 2013 Top-N Ranking Prediction ImplicitMFLK, ItemKNNLK, UserKNNLK, PopularityLK, ItemKNNRP, NMFRP, SVDRP, BPRRB, ItemKNNRB, PopularityRB Hetrec-Lastfm, Movielens-100K, Movielens-1M, Gowalla 2023 Top-N Ranking Prediction ImplicitMFLK, ItemKNNLK, UserKNNLK, PopularityLK, ItemKNNRP, NMFRP, SVDRP, BPRRB, DGCFRB, DMFRB, ItemKNNRB, LightGCNRB, MacridVAERB, MultiVAERB, NAISRB, NCLRB, NeuMFRB, NGCFRB, PopularityRB, RecVAERB, SGLRB Gowalla, Hetrec-LastFM, MovieLens: -100K, -1M, -Latest-Small, Amazon2018: -Electronics, -Toys-And-Games, -CDs-And-Vinyl, -Sports-And-Outdoors, -Books, Yelp-2018, Retailrocket
references:
Our research paper study indicates that experimental pipelines from 2013 and 2023 exhibit notable differences (Section 3).
For instance, in 2023, all but one paper focused on top-n ranking prediction tasks, whereas in 2013, around half of the papers focused on rating prediction tasks.
Additionally, in 2023, experiments often utilize datasets from the Amazon-2018 series, which were not available in 2013.
Consequently, we introduce three distinct representative pipelines to account for these differences.
Table 3 provides an overview of the algorithms and datasets used for specific pipelines.

references: We conduct all experiments across four computers with different hardware configurations from different years to assess the impact of hardware efficiency on energy consumption and, consequently, the carbon footprint. Computer hardware has become increasingly efficient over the years (Koomey et al., 2011). We perform experiments on four computers spanning the last decade to evaluate the impact on hardware efficiency and whether the improvement can offset the energy demands of transitioning to deep learning. We present the hardware specifications used in our experiments in (Koomey et al., 2011). We perform experiments on four computers spanning the last decade to evaluate the impact on hardware efficiency and whether the improvement can offset the energy demands of transitioning to deep learning. We present the hardware specifications used in our experiments in Table 4.
